headline: McDonald’s CEO is grappling with a ‘two-tier economy’ as he slashes prices on value meals—and signals backing for a minimum wage increase
summary: “Particularly with middle- and lower-income consumers, they’re feeling under a lot of pressure right now,” Chris Kempczinski said on CNBC.

headline: Value menus seem to be driving restaurant traffic
summary: New data from Circana finds that 50% of consumers who have not recently dined out would be motivated to do so for lower prices

headline: Chipotle Stock Is Down 30% This Year. Why There’s ‘Plenty Left in the Bowl’ for Investors.
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill  has a had a brutal year, but the bowl and burrito chain may be due for a rebound, says Rothschild & Co Redburn.  The firm upgraded Chipotle to Buy from Neutral in a Wednesday research note and left its $55 price target unchanged.  The upgrade did little to move Chipotle’s stock, which was up 0.2% to $41.82 on Wednesday, but that’s a decent day by 2025 standards.

The upgrade did little to move Chipotle’s stock, which was up 0.2% to $41.82 on Wednesday, but that’s a decent day by 2025 standards.

headline: McDonald’s CEO says Trump’s no tax on tips amplifies an ‘uneven playing field’ for its restaurants, which don’t get ‘customers to pay’ for labor
summary: Chris Kempczinski raised concerns that restaurants paying tipped workers lower minimum wages were getting an extra boost from the White House’s new provision.

headline: Southern Glazer’s Wine & Spirits Names Steve Bronson as Chief Information Officer
summary: MIAMI & DALLAS, September 03, 2025--Southern Glazer’s announced Steve Bronson as Chief Information Officer (CIO), reporting to David Chaplin, Chief Growth and Strategy Officer.

headline: McDonald's CEO warns of 'two-tiered economy'
summary: McDonald’s CEO Chris Kempczinski warned of a "two-tier economy" as the company reintroduced its Extra Value Meals to draw budget-conscious customers.
